Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to section 26 of the Energy Efficiency Acta, a copy of the proposed Energy Efficiency Regulations, 2016, substantially in the annexed form, was published in the Canada Gazette, Part I, on April 30, 2016;

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources, pursuant to sections 20b and 25 of the Energy Efficiency Acta, makes the annexed Energy Efficiency Regulations, 2016.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Energy Efficiency Act. (Loi)
adhesive tag means a label that is attached to an energy-using product by at least two strips of adhesive that are located on opposite edges of the label. (étiquette adhésive)
AHRI means the Air-Conditioning, Heating and Refrigeration Institute. (AHRI)
ANSI means the American National Standards Institute. (ANSI)
ASHRAE means the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-Conditioning Engineers, Inc. (ASHRAE)
CGA means the Canadian Gas Association. (ACG)
CIE means the International Commission on Illumination. (CIE)
CSA means the Canadian Standards Association. (CSA)
flap tag means a label whose top edge is attached to an energy-using product by one strip of adhesive. (vignette)
hang tag means a label that is attached to an energy-using product by material that is looped around a section of the product so that the label hangs freely from the product. (étiquette volante)
household means manufactured or sold primarily for use in a dwelling. (domestique)
IEC means the International Electrotechnical Commission. (CEI)
IEEE means the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers. (IEEE)
IES means the Illuminating Engineering Society of North America. (IES)
mains power means an alternating current electric power source that is in a building and is less than or equal to a nominal 240-volt single-phase supply. (alimentation principale)

model number means, in respect of any model of an energy-using product, the designator that is assigned to that model for the purposes of these Regulations and that distinguishes it from similar models. (numéro de modèle)
NEMA means the National Electrical Manufacturers Association. (NEMA)
unique motor identifier means an identifier consisting of the information set out below, in the following sequence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer, in abbreviated form;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nominal power of the motor, expressed in kilowatts for an IEC design motor or in horsepower for a NEMA design motor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of poles; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the motor is of open or enclosed construction. (identificateur unique du moteur)

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations, a reference to an energy-using product is a reference to that product as defined in the Division or Subdivision associated with it.
In these Regulations, a reference to an AHRI, ANSI, ASHRAE, CGA, CIE, CSA or IES standard is to be read as a reference to the standard as amended from time to time.

Section.MarginalNote: Standards and procedures of other jurisdiction incorporated by reference
Section.Text: Despite these Regulations, if an energy efficiency standard or test procedure that is incorporated by reference in these Regulations as amended from time to time is a reference to a standard or test procedure set out in the laws of another jurisdiction and that standard or procedure is subsequently repealed or revoked in that other jurisdiction, the reference to the standard or procedure in these Regulations is deemed to be a reference to that standard or procedure as it read on the day before the day on which it was repealed or revoked and it continues to apply for the purposes of these Regulations.
The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: certification body means, in respect of an energy-using product, a body that is accredited by the Standards Council of Canada to operate a certification program in respect of the energy efficiency of the product. (organisme de certification)
verification mark means, in respect of an energy-using product, a mark that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: issued by a certification body to signify that the body has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: determined that the product complies with the applicable energy efficiency standard, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the product is one for which information must be provided to the Minister for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, verified the information that is related to the product’s energy performance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: issued by a province to signify that the product complies with the province’s energy efficiency standard. (marque de vérification)

Section.Text: Unless otherwise specified by these Regulations, an energy-using product that is incorporated into another product remains an energy-using product for the purposes of these Regulations even if the other product is not an energy-using product.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) to (5), every energy-using product that, for the purpose of sale or lease, is shipped from one province to another or imported into Canada must be labelled with a verification mark that is issued by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a certification body; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a province whose energy efficiency standard for the product is equivalent to or exceeds the energy efficiency standard prescribed for the product in these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The verification mark must be readily visible on the surface of the energy-using product. However, in respect of the following energy-using products, the verification mark may be on the exterior of the product’s package:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a CFL;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a general service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a modified spectrum incandescent lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a general service fluorescent lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a general service incandescent reflector lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a battery charger; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an external power supply.

Subsection.Text: A CFL is not required to be labelled with a verification mark if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a laboratory that is accredited to test the energy performance of lighting products by either the Standards Council of Canada or the National Voluntary Laboratory Accreditation Program has verified the values for nominal power, luminous flux and correlated colour temperature provided to the Minister under subsection 432(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a laboratory that is referred to in paragraph (a), an A2LA certified laboratory or an ISO 9000 certified laboratory or manufacturing facility has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the life testing of the CFL is completed, verified the value for life provided to the Minister under subsection 432(1), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the life testing of the CFL is not completed, verified 40% of its design life and at that point in the testing not more than one unit in the test sample has failed.

Subsection.Text: An external power supply is not required to be labelled with a verification mark if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is labelled with a mark in accordance with the U.S. Department of Energy publication entitled “International Efficiency Marking Protocol for External Power Supplies”, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a certification body has verified the information related to the product’s energy performance that is provided to the Minister for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is labelled with the same model number as that used when the information was verified.

Subsection.Text: Until March 31, 2018, a general service lamp is not required to be labelled with a verification mark if a certification body

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has determined that the lamp complies with the applicable energy efficiency standard; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has verified the information related to the product’s energy performance that is provided to the Minister for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A dealer who, for the purpose of sale or lease, ships an energy-using product from one province to another or imports an energy-using product into Canada must, for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, provide the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the product as prescribed in these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the product, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s model number or, in the case of a motor, the product’s model number or unique motor identifier;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the product’s manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: one of the following, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the certification body or province whose verification mark will be on the product or its package,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a CFL, the name of the laboratory referred to in paragraph 4(3)(a) and the name of the laboratory or manufacturing facility referred to in paragraph 4(3)(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an external power supply, the name of the certification body referred to in paragraph 4(4)(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a general service lamp or modified spectrum incandescent lamp for which there is no energy efficiency standard, if a laboratory that is accredited to test the energy performance of lighting products by either the Standards Council of Canada or the National Voluntary Laboratory Accreditation Program has verified the information displayed on the product’s package, the name of that laboratory;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is prescribed in these Regulations to be provided to the Minister for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether a mathematical model described in subsection (3) was used to generate any of the information provided under paragraph (f).

Subsection.Text: The information must be provided electronically or by fax, hand delivery, courier or mail before the product is imported into Canada or shipped from one province to another.

Despite any provision in these Regulations requiring that the information referred to in this section be collected in accordance with an identified standard, a dealer may instead provide the information as generated by a mathematical model that, by means of an engineering or statistical analysis or a computer simulation or model, emulates the manner in which the information is collected under the identified standard.
Despite paragraph 5(1)(f), a dealer is not required to provide information related to the life of a CFL if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the information is to be provided the life testing of the product is not completed, but 40% of the product’s design life has been verified as described in subparagraph 4(3)(b)(ii); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer provides the following information to the Minister together with the information provided under subsection 5(1):

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement indicating that 40% of the product’s design life has been verified,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which life testing began,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the design life of the product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of hours of life that have been verified.

Subsection.Text: Within 30 days after the day on which the life testing of the CFL is completed, the dealer must provide the Minister with the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s life as verified; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the laboratory or manufacturing facility that performed the verification, if it is different from the name provided under subparagraph 5(1)(e)(ii).

Subsection.Text: A dealer who, for the purpose of sale or lease, imports an energy-using product into Canada must, for the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, provide the following information to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the product as prescribed in these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the product, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s model number or, in the case of a motor, the product’s model number or unique motor identifier;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s address; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the product is being imported

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for sale or lease in Canada without modification,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for sale or lease in Canada after being modified to comply with the applicable energy efficiency standard, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for incorporation into any other product that is to be exported from Canada.

Subsection.Text: However, the following energy-using products are not energy-using products for the purpose of subsection (1) if, at the time of their importation, they are incorporated into another product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a battery charger;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an external power supply;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp ballast;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an electric motor; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a small electric motor.

Subsection.Text: The information must be provided by including it in any customs invoice or commercial invoice that is required to be provided in respect of the energy-using product under subsection 6(1) of the Accounting for Imported Goods and Payment of Duties Regulations and must be provided before the product is released under the Customs Act.

Heading.TitleText: Exemptions from Certain Provisions of the Act

Subsection.Text: A dealer is exempt from the application of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act if the dealer, for the purpose of modifying an energy-using product to comply with the applicable energy efficiency standard, ships the product from the province in which it was manufactured to another province or imports the product into Canada.
The dealer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the product is brought into compliance with the applicable energy efficiency standard within 90 days after the day on which the product is shipped or imported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite subsection 5(2), provide the information referred to in subsection 5(1) within 120 days after the day on which the product is shipped or imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if requested by the Minister, provide the Minister with any other information that is necessary to establish that the product has been brought into compliance with the applicable energy efficiency standard.

Section.MarginalNote: Exemption — incorporation into product for export
Section.Text: A dealer is exempt from the application of sections 4 and 5 of the Act with respect to the shipment or importation of an energy-using product that is to be incorporated into any other product that is to be exported from Canada.

A dealer is exempt from the application of sections 4 and 5 of the Act if the dealer, for the purpose of exporting the energy-using product from Canada, ships the product from the province in which it was manufactured to another province or imports the product into Canada.

Section.MarginalNote: Exemption — motors with same unique motor identifier
Section.Text: A dealer is exempt from the application of section 5 of the Act in respect of a motor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information has been provided in respect of a motor that has the same unique motor identifier; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the motor is at least as energy efficient as the motor for which the information was provided.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix D2 means Appendix D2 to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Clothes Dryers, as amended from time to time. (appendice D2 10 C.F.R.)
CSA C300-12 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C300-12 entitled Energy Performance and Capacity of Household Refrigerators, Refrigerator-Freezers, Freezers and Wine Chillers. (CSA C300-12)
CSA C300-15 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C300-15 entitled Energy Performance and Capacity of Household Refrigerators, Refrigerator-Freezers, Freezers and Wine Chillers. (CSA C300-15)
CSA C358-03 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C358-03 entitled Energy Consumption Test Methods for Household Electric Ranges. (CSA C358-03)
CSA C360-03 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C360-03 entitled Energy Performance, Water Consumption and Capacity of Household Clothes Washers. (CSA C360-03)
CSA C360-13 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C360-13 entitled Energy Performance, Water Consumption and Capacity of Household Clothes Washers. (CSA C360-13)
CSA C361-16 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C361-16 entitled Energy performance and drum volume of household electric clothes dryers. (CSA C361-16)
CSA C361-92 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C361-92 entitled Test Method for Measuring Energy Consumption and Drum Volume of Electrically Heated Household Tumble-Type Clothes Dryers. (CSA C361-92)

Subsection.Text: An energy-using product prescribed in any of Subdivisions A to G or K of this Division must be labelled in the form set out in Schedule 1.
The label must be an adhesive tag, flap tag or hang tag that is attached to the product so that the tag is readily visible when the product is viewed from the front.

The paper that is used for adhesive tags or flap tags must weigh, exclusive of the release liner and adhesive, not less than the equivalent of 26.31 kg (58 pounds) per 500 sheets measuring 63.5 cm (25 inches) by 96.52 cm (38 inches).
The adhesive that is used to attach an adhesive tag or a flap tag to an energy-using product must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: render the tag easily removable from the product without the use of a tool or any liquid other than water; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have an adhesion capacity that is sufficient to prevent the tag from being dislodged from the product under normal handling conditions.

Subsection.Text: The paper that is used for hang tags must weigh not less than the equivalent of 49.9 kg (110 pounds) per 500 sheets measuring 64.77 cm (25.5 inches) by 77.47 cm (30.5 inches).

The material that is used to attach a hang tag to an energy-using product must be of sufficient strength to ensure that when gradual pressure is applied to the tag by pulling it away from the product, the tag will tear before the material breaks.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, clothes dryer means a household tumble-type clothes dryer that is electrically operated.
For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of a clothes dryer is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compact, if it has a drum capacity of less than 125 L (4.4 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard, if it has a drum capacity of 125 L (4.4 cubic feet) or more.

Subsection.Text: A clothes dryer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 19, a clothes dryer is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to clothes dryers that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A clothes dryer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a clothes dryer as defined in section 16.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before January 1, 2015
CSA C361-16 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix D2

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a clothes dryer described in column 1.

row.entry: Clothes dryers manufactured on or after February 3, 1995 and before January 1, 2015

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: capacity, in L, of clothes dryer’s drum;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: drying controls the product has, namely, timed, auto-temp or auto-moisture.

row.entry: Clothes dryers manufactured on or after January 1, 2015
CSA C361-16 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix D2

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: capacity, in L, of clothes dryer’s drum;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: combined energy factor in kg/kWh; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: drying controls the product has, namely, timed, auto-temp or auto-moisture.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, clothes washer means an electrically operated clothes washer that does not require mechanical fastening to a floor or wall, is top- or front-loaded and has an internal control system that regulates the water temperature without the need for user intervention after the machine is set in operation.
For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of a clothes washer is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compact, if it has a container capacity of less than 45 L (1.6 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard, if it has a container capacity of 45 L (1.6 cubic feet) or more.

Subsection.Text: A clothes washer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a clothes washer is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 24, unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 13 to 15, unless it is a household clothes washer and it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to clothes washers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A clothes washer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a clothes washer as defined in section 21.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: combination clothes washer-dryer means a household appliance that has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a clothes washer function and clothes dryer function that utilize the same drum;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a common control panel for both functions; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: one power source. (laveuse-sécheuse combinée)

Definition.Text: integrated clothes washer-dryer means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a household appliance that consists of a clothes washer component and a clothes dryer component located above, below or beside it, that is powered by one power source and that has its control panel located on one of the components; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a combination clothes washer-dryer. (laveuse-sécheuse)

Definition.Text: V means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an integrated clothes washer-dryer that is not a combination clothes washer-dryer, the volumes, expressed in litres, of the basket for the clothes washer component and of the drum for the clothes dryer component; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an integrated clothes washer-dryer that is a combination clothes washer-dryer, the volume, expressed in litres, of the drum. (V)

Section.MarginalNote: Size category — other than combination clothes washer-dryer

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of an integrated clothes washer-dryer that is not a combination clothes washer-dryer is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compact, if it has a clothes dryer component with a drum capacity of less than 125 L (4.4 cubic feet) and a clothes washer component with a basket capacity of less than 45 L (1.6 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard, if it has a clothes dryer component with a drum capacity of 125 L (4.4 cubic feet) or more and a clothes washer component with a basket capacity of 45 L (1.6 cubic feet) or more.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of an integrated clothes washer-dryer that is a combination clothes washer is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compact, if it has a drum capacity of less than 45 L (1.6 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard, if it has a drum capacity of 45 L (1.6 cubic feet) or more.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, an integrated clothes washer-dryer is one of the following types, namely, combination, over/under or side-by-side.

Subsection.Text: An integrated clothes washer-dryer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 30, an integrated clothes washer-dryer is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to integrated clothes washer-dryers that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

An integrated clothes washer-dryer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to an integrated clothes washer-dryer as defined in section 26.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C373-04 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C373-04 entitled Energy Consumption Test Methods and Limits for Household Dishwashers. (CSA C373-04)
CSA C373-14 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C373-14 entitled Energy Performance and Water Consumption of Household Dishwashers. (CSA C373-14)
dishwasher means an electrically operated automatic household dishwasher. (lave-vaisselle)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of a dishwasher is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compact, if it has a capacity of less than eight place settings and six serving pieces; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard, if it has a capacity that is equal to or greater than eight place settings and six serving pieces.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a dishwasher is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: built-in, if it is designed to be permanently connected to a water and electric supply in a dwelling; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: portable, if it is designed not to be permanently connected to a water and electric supply in a dwelling.

Section.Text: In respect of a dishwasher that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010, a reference to “annual energy consumption” in Schedule 1 is to be read as a reference to “total annual energy consumption”.

Subsection.Text: A dishwasher is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 37, a dishwasher is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to dishwashers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A dishwasher complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a dishwasher as defined in section 32.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: combination refrigerator-freezer means a household combination refrigerator-freezer that has a defrost system, including a compressor-cycled automatic defrost system and a capacity of 1 105 L (39 cubic feet) or less. (réfrigérateur-congélateur)

compressor-cycled automatic defrost system means a defrost system in which the defrosting action for the refrigerated spaces occurs using the natural warming of the evaporator and that is automatically initiated when the compressor is cycled on and automatically terminated when the compressor is cycled off. (dispositif de dégivrage automatique à cycle du compresseur)

refrigerator means a household refrigerator that has a capacity of 1 105 L (39 cubic feet) or less and that has a defrost system, including a compressor-cycled automatic defrost system. It does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a household refrigerator that uses an absorption refrigeration system; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a miscellaneous refrigeration product. (réfrigérateur)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of a refrigerator or combination refrigerator-freezer is the capacity range set out below within which the actual size of the product falls or that is closest to the actual size of the product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: less than 70 L (2.5 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 70 to 126 L (2.5 to 4.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 127 to 182 L (4.5 to 6.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 183 to 239 L (6.5 to 8.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 240 to 295 L (8.5 to 10.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 296 to 352 L (10.5 to 12.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: 353 to 409 L (12.5 to 14.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: 410 to 465 L (14.5 to 16.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: 466 to 522 L (16.5 to 18.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: 523 to 579 L (18.5 to 20.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: 580 to 635 L (20.5 to 22.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: 636 to 692 L (22.5 to 24.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: 693 to 748 L (24.5 to 26.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: 749 to 805 L (26.5 to 28.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: 806 to 862 L (28.5 to 30.4 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: 863 to 1 105 L (30.5 to 39.0 cubic feet).

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a refrigerator or combination refrigerator-freezer is one of the product types (1) to (7-BI) and (11) to (15I) of Table 1 to CSA C300-15.

Subsection.Text: Refrigerators and combination refrigerator-freezers are prescribed as energy-using products.

However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 43, a refrigerator or combination refrigerator-freezer is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to refrigerators and combination refrigerator-freezers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A refrigerator complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a refrigerator as defined in section 39.

A combination refrigerator-freezer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a combination-refrigerator freezer as defined in section 39.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before September 15, 2014

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a refrigerator or combination refrigerator-freezer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of its fresh food compartment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of its freezer compartment, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its adjusted volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its annual energy consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-12, if the product was manufactured on or after February 3, 1995 and before September 15, 2014; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-15, if the product is manufactured on or after September 15, 2014.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, freezer means a household freezer that has a capacity of 850 L (30 cubic feet) or less.

For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of a freezer is the capacity range set out below within which the actual size of the product falls or that is closest to the actual size of the product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: less than 155 L (5.5 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 155 to 210 L (5.5 to 7.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 211 to 267 L (7.5 to 9.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 268 to 324 L (9.5 to 11.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 325 to 380 L (11.5 to 13.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 381 to 437 L (13.5 to 15.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: 438 to 494 L (15.5 to 17.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: 495 to 550 L (17.5 to 19.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: 551 to 607 L (19.5 to 21.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: 608 to 664 L (21.5 to 23.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: 665 to 720 L (23.5 to 25.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: 721 to 777 L (25.5 to 27.4 cubic feet);

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: 778 to 833 L (27.5 to 29.4 cubic feet); or

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: 834 to 850 L (29.5 to 30.0 cubic feet).

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a freezer is one of the types described in the product types (8) to (10A) and (16) to (18) of Table 1 to CSA C300-15.

Subsection.Text: A freezer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 49, a freezer is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to freezers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A freezer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a freezer as defined in section 45.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before September 15, 2014

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a freezer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its total refrigerated volume;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its adjusted volume;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its annual energy consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its ice freezing capacity, expressed in kilograms per 24 hours.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-12, if the product was manufactured on or after February 3, 1995 and before September 15, 2014; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-15, if the product is manufactured on or after September 15, 2014.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: conventional cooking top means a cooking top that is not a modular cooking top. (table de cuisson traditionnelle)
E means energy consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours per month. (E)
electric range means a household electric range. It does not include a portable range that is designed for an electrical supply of 120 V or a microwave oven. (cuisinière électrique)
modular cooking top means a cartridge that consists of at least one surface element and that can be plugged into a receptacle on the surface of an electric range. (table de cuisson modulaire)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the size category of an electric range that has at least one surface element and at least one oven is one of the following, based on the product’s exterior width:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 60.96 cm (24 inches);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 76.2 cm (30 inches);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 91.44 cm (36 inches); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 121.92 cm (48 inches).

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, an electric range is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it has at least one oven, either self-cleaning or non-self-cleaning; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it has no oven, all models.

Subsection.Text: An electric range is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 55, an electric range is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to electric ranges described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

An electric range complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C358-03 that are applicable to an electric range as defined in section 51.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, gas range means a household propane or natural gas range that has an electrical power source, is used for food preparation and provides at least one of the following functions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: surface cooking;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: oven cooking; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: broiling.

Subsection.Text: A gas range is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 59, a gas range is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

Section.Text: The energy efficiency standard that applies to a gas range is that it must not have a continuously burning pilot light.
For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C358-03 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas range:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of usable oven space, expressed in litres;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product is built-in or free-standing; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the broiler configuration, namely, open or closed.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C749-07 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C749-07 entitled Performance of Dehumidifiers. (CSA C749-07)
CSA C749-94 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C749-94 entitled Performance of Dehumidifiers. (CSA C749-94)
dehumidifier means a household appliance that is primarily designed to remove moisture from the air and is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: self-contained and encased;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: electrically operated; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: mechanically refrigerated. (déshumidificateur)

Definition.Text: portable dehumidifier means a dehumidifier that is not a whole-home dehumidifier. (déshumidificateur portatif)

10 C.F.R. Appendix X1 means Appendix X1 to Subpart B of Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Dehumidifiers, as amended from time to time. (appendice X1 10 C.F.R.)

10 C.F.R. §430.32(v)(2) means the table to paragraph 430.32(v)(2) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(v)(2))
whole-home dehumidifier means a dehumidifier that is designed to be installed in an air duct. (déshumidificateur à conduit)

Subsection.Text: A dehumidifier is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 63, a dehumidifier is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a whole-home dehumidifier, it is manufactured on or after June 13, 2019.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to dehumidifiers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A dehumidifier complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a dehumidifier as defined in section 61.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a dehumidifier described in column 1.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C388-15 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C388-15 entitled Energy performance and capacity measurement of household microwave ovens. (CSA C388-15)

microwave oven means a household cooking appliance that is designed to cook or heat food in a compartment by means of microwave energy and includes one that has a thermal element that is designed for the surface browning of food. (four à micro-ondes)

10 C.F.R. Appendix I means Appendix I to Subpart B of Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Cooking Products, as amended from time to time. (appendice I 10 C.F.R.)
10 C.F.R. §430.32(j)(3) means paragraph 430.32(j)(3) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(j)(3))

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a microwave oven is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: microwave-only oven;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: countertop convection microwave oven;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: built-in convection microwave oven; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: over-the-range convection microwave oven.

Subsection.Text: A microwave oven is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 68, a microwave oven is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after March 31, 2019.
The energy efficiency standard for a microwave oven is the standard set out for that type of microwave oven in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(j)(3).

A microwave oven complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C388-15 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix I that are applicable to a microwave oven as defined in section 65.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a microwave oven:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its volume, expressed in litres (cubic feet); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its standby power, expressed in watts, as collected in accordance with CSA C388-15 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix I.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix A means Appendix A to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Refrigerators, Refrigerator-Freezers, and Miscellaneous Refrigeration Products, as amended from time to time, except for the waiver referred to in section 7 of that Appendix. (appendice A 10 C.F.R.)

10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(1) means the table to paragraph 430.32(aa)(1) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(1))

10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(2) means the table to paragraph 430.32(aa)(2) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(2))

miscellaneous refrigeration product means a household refrigeration product, which includes a cooler and combination cooler refrigeration product, but does not include a refrigerator, refrigerator-freezer or freezer. (appareil de réfrigération divers)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a miscellaneous refrigeration product is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it was manufactured on or after January 1, 2008 and before October 28, 2019, a type described in any of the product types (19) or (20) of Table 1 to CSA C300-15; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after October 28, 2019, a cooler of a product class described in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(1) or a combination cooler refrigeration product of a product class described in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(aa)(2).

Subsection.Text: A miscellaneous refrigeration product is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 73, a miscellaneous refrigeration product is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2008 and before October 28, 2019, and is a type (19) or (20) as described in Table 1 to CSA C300-15; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is manufactured on or after October 28, 2019.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to miscellaneous refrigeration products described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A miscellaneous refrigeration product complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a miscellaneous refrigeration product as defined in section 70.

row.entry: On or after January 1, 2008 and before September 15, 2014
On or after September 15, 2014 and before October 28, 2019
Miscellaneous refrigeration products – combination cooler refrigeration products

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a miscellaneous refrigeration product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its adjusted volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its annual energy consumption expressed in kilowatt-hours.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-12 if the product was manufactured on or after January 1, 2008 and before September 15, 2014;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C300-15 if the product was manufactured on or after September 15, 2014 and before October 28, 2019; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix A if the product is manufactured on or after October 28, 2019.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix U means Appendix U to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Ceiling Fans, as amended from time to time. (appendice U 10 C.F.R.)

10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(2)(i) means the table to subparagraph 430.32(s)(2)(i) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(2)(i))
ceiling fan means a non-portable device that is suspended from a ceiling for circulating air via the rotation of fan blades. It does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a ceiling fan if the plane of rotation of the fan blades is greater than 45 degrees from horizontal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a centrifugal ceiling fan;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a belt-driven ceiling fan;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an oscillating ceiling fan; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a ceiling fan with a maximum rotational speed of 90 RPM and a maximum airflow of 52.1 cubic metres/minute (1840 cubic feet/minute). (ventilateur de plafond)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a ceiling fan is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: very small diameter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: standard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hugger;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: high-speed small-diameter; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: large-diameter.

Subsection.Text: A ceiling fan is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 78, a ceiling fan is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 21, 2020.
The energy efficiency standard for a ceiling fan is the standard as set out in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(2)(i).

A ceiling fan complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix U that are applicable to a ceiling fan as defined in section 75.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with 10 C.F.R. Appendix U and provided to the Minister in respect of a ceiling fan:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its blade span;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its air flow at high speed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its ceiling fan efficiency; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its standby power consumption expressed in watts.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Air Conditioners, Condensing Units and Chillers

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C656-05 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C656-05 entitled Performance Standard for Split-System and Single-Package Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C656-05)
CSA C656-14 means the CSA standard CSA-C656-14 entitled Performance Standard for Split-System and Single-Package Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C656-14)
CSA C746-06 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-06 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Large and Single Packaged Vertical Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C746-06)
CSA C746-98 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-98 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Large Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C746-98)
small-duct and high-velocity, with respect to a single package central air conditioner or a split-system central air conditioner, means one that has an indoor blower and coil combination that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produces at least 300 Pa (1.2 inches of water) external static pressure when operated at an air volume rate of 104 to 165 L/s (220 to 350 cubic feet/minute) per nominal ton of cooling; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: uses room outlets that produce velocities greater than 5 m/s (1,000 feet/minute) and that each have an area less than 39 cm2 (6 square inches). (à grand débit et à petits conduits)

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix M means Appendix M to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps, as amended from time to time. (appendice M 10 C.F.R)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CEER means the combined energy efficiency ratio of the product, expressed in British thermal units per watt hour, that constitutes a single measure of its energy efficiency and that integrates standby mode and off mode energy use with on mode energy use. (CEER)
CSA C368.1 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C368.1-M90 entitled Performance Standard for Room Air Conditioners. (CSA C368.1)
CSA C368.1-14 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C368.1-14 entitled Energy performance of room air conditioners. (CSA C368.1-14)
CSA C62301 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C62301:11 entitled Household Electrical Appliances – Measurement of Standby Power. (CSA C62301)

room air conditioner means a single-phase electric air conditioner that has a cooling capacity of 10.55 kW (36,000 Btu/h) or less. It does not include a packaged terminal air conditioner, a portable air conditioner or a single package vertical air conditioner. (climatiseur individuel)

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, a room air conditioner is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V louvred with reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V louvred without reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V non-louvred with reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V non-louvred without reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V casement-only;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 120 V casement-slider;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V louvred with reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V louvred without reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V non-louvred with reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V non-louvred without reverse cycle;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V casement-only; or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: 240 V casement-slider.

Section.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the cooling capacity category of a room air conditioner is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the product was manufactured before June 1, 2014, the applicable cooling capacity range set out in Table 2 of CSA C368.1; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is manufactured on or after June 1, 2014, the applicable cooling capacity range set out in Table 1 of CSA C368.1-14.

Subsection.Text: A room air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5, 13 to 15 and 112, a room air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to room air conditioners that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A room air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a room air conditioner as defined in section 108.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before June 1, 2014

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard or provision set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a room air conditioner described in column 1.

row.entry: Room air conditioners manufactured before June 1, 2014
CSA C368.1, for information set out in paragraphs (b) to (d)
Room air conditioners manufactured on or after June 1, 2014

Provision.Text: CSA 368.1-14, for information set out in paragraphs (b) and (c)

Section.Text: A room air conditioner must be labelled

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it was manufactured before June 1, 2014, in the form set out in Schedule 2; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after June 1, 2014, in the form set out in Schedule 3.

Section.Text: The label must either be displayed on the principal display panel of the product’s package or must be one of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an adhesive tag that meets the requirements of section 14 and that is attached to the product or the principal display panel of its package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a flap tag that meets the requirements of section 14 and that is attached to the product; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a hang tag that meets the requirements of section 15 and that is attached to the product.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: AHRI 340/360 means the AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 340/360-2007 entitled Performance Rating of Commercial and Industrial Unitary Air-Conditioning and Heat Pump Equipment. (AHRI 340/360)
CSA C746-17 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-17 entitled Energy performance rating for large and single packaged vertical air conditioners and heat pumps. (CSA C746-17)

IEER means the integrated energy efficiency ratio, expressed in British thermal units per watt hour, that constitutes a single number cooling part-load efficiency metric of a large air conditioner. (IEER)

large air conditioner means a commercial or industrial unitary air conditioner with a cooling capacity of at least 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) but less than 223 kW (760,000 Btu/h). It does not include a single package vertical air conditioner. (climatiseur de grande puissance)

Subsection.Text: A large air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 118, a large air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a large air conditioner with a cooling capacity of less than 70 kW, it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a large air conditioner with a cooling capacity of 70 kW or more, it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010.

Section.MarginalNote: Energy efficiency standards — cooled by air

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to large air conditioners that are cooled by air and described in column 1 and that are manufactured during the period set out in column 4.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Energy efficiency standards — cooled by water
Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to large air conditioners that are cooled by water and described in column 1 and that are manufactured during the period set out in column 4.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Energy efficiency standards — cooled by evaporation
Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 3 to this section apply to large air conditioners that are cooled by evaporation and described in column 1 and that are manufactured during the period set out in column 4.

A large air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard set out in column 3 if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a large air conditioner as defined in section 116.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a large air conditioner described in column 1.

row.entry: Large air conditioners manufactured on or after December 31, 1998 and before January 1, 2010

Provision.Label: (a)

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: information that indicates whether the product has a heating section and, if so, whether it is electric or other than electric.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C744-04 means the joint CSA and AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 310/380-2004/CAN/CSA-C744-04 entitled Standard for Packaged Terminal Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C744-04)
CSA C744-14 means the joint CSA and AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 310/380-2014/CAN/CSA-C744-14 entitled Standard for Packaged Terminal Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C744-14)
CSA C744-17 means the joint CSA and AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 310/380-2017/CAN/CSA-C744-17 entitled Packaged terminal air-conditioners and heat pumps. (CSA C744-17 )
packaged terminal air conditioner means a factory-built packaged terminal air conditioner that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consists of a wall sleeve and a separate unencased cooling component and is intended to cool a single room or zone; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consists of a wall sleeve and a separate unencased combination of heating and cooling components and is intended to heat and cool a single room or zone. (climatiseur terminal autonome)

Subsection.Text: A packaged terminal air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 122, a packaged terminal air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to packaged terminal air conditioners that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A packaged terminal air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a packaged terminal air conditioner as defined in section 120.

row.entry: On or after December 31, 1998 and before September 30, 2012
On or after September 30, 2012 and before January 1, 2017

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a packaged terminal air conditioner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its energy efficiency ratio; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, identification of the product as a replacement unit.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C744-04, if the product was manufactured on or after December 31, 1998 and before September 30, 2012;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C744-14, if the product was manufactured on or after September 30, 2012 and before January 1, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C744-17, if the product is manufactured on or after January 1, 2017.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode power consumption means the power consumption when the unit is connected to mains power but is not providing cooling or heating. (consommation d’énergie en mode arrêt)

single package central air conditioner means a single-phase or three-phase central air conditioner that is a single package unit and that has a cooling capacity of less than 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h). It does not include a single package vertical air conditioner. (climatiseur central monobloc)

through-the-wall means, in respect of a single package central air conditioner, one that has a cooling capacity less than or equal to 8.79 kW (30,000 Btu/h) and that is designed to be installed through an exterior wall. (mural)

Subsection.Text: A single package central air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 126, a single package central air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to single-phase single package central air conditioners described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to three-phase single package central air conditioners described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A single package central air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a single package central air conditioner as defined in section 124.

row.entry: Single package central air conditioners, other than those that are through-the-wall or small-duct and high-velocity
On or after February 3, 1995 and before January 1, 2017
Single package central air conditioners, other than those that are through-the-wall or small-duct and high-velocity

10 C.F.R. Appendix M for off mode power consumption

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of single package vertical air conditioner
Section.Text: In this Subdivision, single package vertical air conditioner means a single package commercial air conditioner, with or without heating capability, that has its major components arranged vertically, is air-cooled and encased and is intended for mounting through, or on either side of, an exterior wall. It does not include a single package commercial air conditioner that has reverse cycle refrigeration.

Subsection.Text: A single package vertical air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.

However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 130, a single package vertical air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2011 and has a cooling capacity of less than 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h).

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to single package vertical air conditioners described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A single package vertical air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C746-17 that are applicable to a single package vertical air conditioner as defined in section 128.

row.entry: Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of < 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h)
On or after January 1, 2011 and before September 23, 2019
Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of < 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h)
Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) and < 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h)
On or after January 1, 2011 and before October 9, 2015
Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) and < 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h)
Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h) and < 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h)
On or after January 1, 2011 and before October 9, 2016
Single package vertical air conditioners that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h) and < 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h)

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C746-17 and provided to the Minister in respect of a single package vertical air conditioner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its energy efficiency ratio.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode power consumption means the power consumption when the unit is connected to mains power but is not providing cooling or heating. (consommation d’énergie en mode arrêt)

split-system central air conditioner means a single-phase or three-phase central air conditioner that is a split-system with a cooling capacity of less than 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h). (climatiseur central bibloc)

Subsection.Text: A split-system central air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 134, a split-system central air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to single-phase split-system central air conditioners described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to three-phase split-system central air conditioners described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A split-system central air conditioner complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a split-system central air conditioner as defined in section 132.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, large condensing unit means a commercial or industrial condensing unit that is intended for air conditioning applications and that has a cooling capacity of at least 40 kW (135,000 Btu/h) but not more than 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: A large condensing unit is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 138, a large condensing unit is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to large condensing units described in column 1.

A large condensing unit complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C746-98 that are applicable to a large condensing unit as defined in section 136.

row.entry: Large condensing units that are cooled by air
Large condensing units that are cooled by water or evaporation

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C746-98 and provided to the Minister in respect of a large condensing unit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its classification as set out in Column II of Table 1 of CSA C746-98;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its energy efficiency ratio.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: ASHRAE 90.1-16 means ANSI/ASHRAE/IES Standard 90.1-2016, entitled Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings. (ASHRAE 90.1-16)

chiller means a machine, with or without an integral refrigerant condenser, that is designed to use a refrigerant cycle to remove heat from a liquid and to reject the heat to a cooling medium. (refroidisseur)
CSA C743-02 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C743-02 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Packaged Water Chillers. (CSA C743-02)
CSA C743-09 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C743-09 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Packaged Water Chillers. (CSA C743-09)

Subsection.Text: A chiller is prescribed as an energy-using product.

However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 142, a chiller is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it has an integral refrigerant condenser and is manufactured on or after October 28, 2004.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to chillers that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A chiller complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a chiller as defined in section 140.

row.entry: On or after October 28, 2004 and before January 1, 2017
Product’s coefficient of performance and integrated part-load value must meet those applicable to the product in CSA C743-09, Path A or Path B, Table 10
On or after January 1, 2017 and before December 31, 2019
Product’s coefficient of performance and integrated part-load value must meet those applicable to the product in ASHRAE 90.1-16, Path A or Path B, Table 6.8.1-3

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a chiller described in column 1.

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: integrated part-load value or non-standard part-load value and a list of non-standard conditions.

Provision.Label: (f)
