Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix CC means Appendix CC to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Portable Air Conditioners, as amended from time to time. (appendice CC 10 C.F.R.)

dual-duct portable air conditioner means a portable air conditioner that draws some or all of the condenser inlet air from outside the conditioned space through a duct attached to an adjustable window bracket and discharges the condenser outlet air outside the conditioned space by means of a separate duct attached to an adjustable window bracket. (climatiseur portative à deux conduits)

portable air conditioner means a single package air conditioner, other than a packaged terminal air conditioner, room air conditioner or dehumidifier, with or without mounted wheels, that is portable and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is designed to deliver cooled and conditioned air to an enclosed space;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is powered by single-phase electric current; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a cooling capacity of less than 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h). (climatiseur portatif)

Definition.Text: single-duct portable air conditioner means a portable air conditioner that draws all of the condenser inlet air from the conditioned space without the means of a duct and discharges the condenser outlet air outside the conditioned space through a single duct attached to an adjustable window bracket. (climatiseur portatif à un conduit unique)

Subsection.Text: A portable air conditioner is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, a portable air conditioner is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after July 1, 2020.

For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with 10 C.F.R. Appendix CC and provided to the Minister in respect of a portable air conditioner:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its seasonally adjusted cooling capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its combined energy efficiency ratio; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether it is a single-duct portable air conditioner or a dual-duct portable air conditioner.

Subsection.Text: For a product with multiple duct configuration options, the information required by paragraphs 1(a) and (b) must be provided for both applicable duct configurations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C656-05 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C656-05 entitled Performance Standard for Split-System and Single-Package Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C656-05)
CSA C656-14 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C656-14 entitled Performance Standard for Split-System and Single-Package Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C656-14)
CSA C746-06 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-06 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Large and Single Packaged Vertical Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C746-06)
CSA C13256-1 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C13256-1-01 entitled Water-Source Heat Pumps — Testing and Rating for Performance — Part 1: Water-to-Air and Brine-to-Air Heat Pumps. (CSA C13256-1)
small-duct and high-velocity means, with respect to a split-system heat pump or a single package heat pump, one that has an indoor blower and coil combination that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produces at least 300 Pa (1.2 inches of water) external static pressure when operated at an air volume rate of 104 to 165 L/s (220 to 350 cubic feet/minute) per nominal ton of cooling; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: uses room outlets that produce velocities greater than 5 m/s (1,000 feet/minute) and that each have an area less than 39 cm2 (6 square inches). (à grand débit et à petits conduits)

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix M means Appendix M to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Central Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps, as amended from time to time. (appendice M 10 C.F.R.)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C446-94 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C446-94 entitled Performance of Ground-Source Heat Pumps. (CSA C446-94)

ground-source heat pump means a single package or split-system heat pump that is factory-built, has a cooling or heating capacity of less than 40 kW (135,000 Btu/h) and is intended for application in an open- or closed-loop ground-source system. (thermopompe géothermique)

Subsection.Text: A ground-source heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 189, a ground-source heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to ground-source heat pumps that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A ground source heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a ground source heat pump as defined in section 187.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before June 1, 2006

Provision.Text: CSA C13256-1, Table 10A, first row, for the open-loop system
CSA C13256-1, Table 10A, second row, for the closed-loop system

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a ground-source heat pump:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its AHRI type classification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling coefficient of performance;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its heating capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its heating coefficient of performance; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the ground-source system for which the product is intended, namely, open-loop, closed-loop or both open-loop and closed-loop.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C446-94, if the product was manufactured on or after February 3, 1995 and before June 1, 2006; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C13256-1, if the product is manufactured on or after June 1, 2006.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of internal water loop heat pump
Section.Text: In this Subdivision, internal water loop heat pump means a water-source single package or split-system heat pump that is factory-built, is intended for installation in an internal water loop system and has a cooling or heating capacity of not more than 40 kW (135,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: An internal water loop heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 193, an internal water loop heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to internal water loop heat pumps described in column 1.

An internal water loop heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C13256-1 that are applicable to an internal water loop heat pump as defined in section 191.

row.entry: Internal water loop heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of < 5 kW

Provision.Text: Cooling coefficient of performance ≥ 3.28 with 30°C inlet water
Heating coefficient of performance ≥ 4.2 with 20°C inlet water

row.entry: Internal water loop heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 5 kW but ≤ 40 kW

Provision.Text: Cooling coefficient of performance ≥ 3.52 with 30°C inlet water
Heating coefficient of performance ≥ 4.2 with 20°C inlet water

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C13256-1 and provided to the Minister in respect of an internal water loop heat pump:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its AHRI type classification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its voltage;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling coefficient of performance with 30°C inlet water;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its heating capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its heating coefficient of performance with 20°C inlet water.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: AHRI 340/360 means the AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 340/360-2007 entitled Performance Rating of Commercial and Industrial Unitary Air-Conditioning and Heat Pump Equipment. (AHRI 340/360)
CSA C746-17 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-17 entitled Energy performance rating for large and single packaged vertical air conditioners and heat pumps. (CSA C746-17)
CSA C746-98 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C746-98 entitled Performance Standard for Rating Large Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C746-98)
IEER means the integrated energy efficiency ratio, expressed in British thermal units per watt hour, that constitutes a single number cooling part-load efficiency metric of a large heat pump. (IEER)

large heat pump means a commercial or industrial unitary heat pump that is intended for air-conditioning and space-heating applications and that has a cooling capacity of at least 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) but less than 223 kW (760,000 Btu/h). It does not include a single package vertical heat pump. (thermopompe de grande puissance)

Subsection.Text: A large heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 197, a large heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a large heat pump with a cooling capacity that is less than 70 kW, it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a large heat pump with a cooling capacity that is greater than or equal to 70 kW, it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to large heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4 and that have no heating section or have an electric heating section.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to large heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4 and that have a heating section other than an electric heating section.

A large heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard set out in column 3 if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a large heat pump as defined in section 195.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C744-04 means the joint CSA and AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 310/380-2004/CAN/CSA-C744-04 entitled Standard for Packaged Terminal Air Conditioners and Heat Pumps. (CSA C744-04)
CSA C744-17 means the joint CSA and AHRI standard ANSI/AHRI 310/380-2017/CSA-C744-17 entitled Packaged terminal air conditioners and heat pumps. (CSA C744-17)

packaged terminal heat pump means a factory-built packaged heat pump that consists of a separate unencased refrigeration system and uses reverse cycle refrigeration as its primary heat source. (thermopompe terminale autonome)

Subsection.Text: A packaged terminal heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 201, a packaged terminal heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to packaged terminal heat pumps that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A packaged terminal heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a packaged terminal heat pump as defined in section 199.

row.entry: On or after December 31, 1998 and before September 30, 2012

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a packaged terminal heat pump:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its energy efficiency ratio;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its heating capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its heating coefficient of performance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, identification of the product as a replacement unit.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C744-04, if the product was manufactured on or after December 31, 1998 and before September 30, 2012; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C744-17, if the product is manufactured on or after September 30, 2012.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode power consumption means the power consumption when the unit is connected to mains power but is not providing cooling or heating. (consommation d’énergie en mode arrêt)

single package heat pump means a single-phase or three-phase air-to-air heat pump that is a centrally ducted single package unit and has a cooling or heating capacity of less than 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h). It does not include a single package vertical heat pump. (thermopompe monobloc)

through-the-wall means, in respect of a single package heat pump, one that has a cooling capacity less than or equal to 8.79 kW (30,000 Btu/h) and that is designed to be installed through an exterior wall. (murale)

Subsection.Text: A single package heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 205, a single package heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to single-phase package heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to three-phase single package heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A single package heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a single package heat pump as defined in section 203.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of single package vertical heat pump
Section.Text: In this Subdivision, single package vertical heat pump means a single package commercial heat pump that is encased, that has its major components arranged vertically and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is air-cooled and uses reverse cycle refrigeration as its primary heat source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is intended for mounting through, or on either side of, an exterior wall.

Subsection.Text: A single package vertical heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.

However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 209, a single package vertical heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2011 and has a cooling capacity of less than 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h).

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to single package vertical heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A single package vertical heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C746-17 that are applicable to a single package vertical heat pump as defined in section 207.

row.entry: Single package vertical heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of < 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h)

Single package vertical heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) and < 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h)
On or after January 1, 2011 and before October 9, 2015
Single package vertical heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h) and < 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h
Single package vertical heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h) and < 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h)
On or after January 1, 2011 and before October 9, 2016
Single package vertical heat pumps that have a cooling capacity of ≥ 39.5 kW (135,000 Btu/h) and < 70 kW (240,000 Btu/h)

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C746-17 and provided to the Minister in respect of a single package vertical heat pump:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its classification set out in columns II and III of Table 2 to CSA C746-17;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its cooling capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its energy efficiency ratio;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its heating capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its heating coefficient of performance.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode power consumption means the power consumption when the unit is connected to mains power but is not providing cooling or heating. (consommation d’énergie en mode arrêt)

split-system heat pump means a single-phase or three-phase air-to-air heat pump that is a centrally ducted split-system and that has a cooling or heating capacity of less than 19 kW (65,000 Btu/h). (thermopompe bibloc)

Subsection.Text: A split-system heat pump is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 213, a split-system heat pump is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to single-phase split-system heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 2 to this section apply to three-phase split-system heat pumps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A split-system heat pump complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a split-system heat pump as defined in section 211.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 4
Heading.TitleText: Furnaces, Fireplaces, Unit Heaters and Recovery Ventilators

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA P.2 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.2-13 entitled Testing method for measuring the annual fuel utilization efficiency of residential gas-fired or oil-fired furnaces and boilers. (CSA P.2)

FER means, in respect of a gas furnace, an oil-fired furnace or an electric furnace, the fan energy rating, which is the annual electrical energy consumption of the furnace fan normalized by annual fan operating hours and the product’s maximum airflow (Qmax). (FER)

10 C.F.R. Appendix AA means Appendix AA to Subpart B of Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Furnace Fans, as amended from time to time. (appendice AA 10 C.F.R.)
10 C.F.R. §430.32(y) means Table 1 to paragraph 430.32(y) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(y))

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA 2.3 means the CSA standard ANSI Z21.47-2016/CSA 2.3-2016 entitled Gas-Fired Central Furnaces. (CSA 2.3)

gas furnace means an automatic operating gas-fired central forced air furnace that uses propane or natural gas and has an input rate of not more than 117.23 kW (400,000 Btu/h). It does not include a furnace for a park model trailer or a recreational vehicle. (générateur d’air chaud à gaz)

gas furnace for relocatable buildings means a gas furnace that is intended for use in a temporary modular building that can be relocated from one site to another and is marked for use in relocatable buildings. (générateur d’air chaud à gaz pour bâtiments relocalisables)
manufactured home means a factory-built, single- or multiple-section, one-storey dwelling that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is designed and constructed for year-round occupancy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is designed to be transported to its installation site; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is ready for occupancy when it is installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s installation instructions. (maison usinée)

Definition.Text: replacement non-condensing gas furnace means a non-condensing gas furnace that is marked for use as a replacement for a non-condensing gas furnace in a manufactured home. (générateur d’air chaud à gaz sans condensation de remplacement)
through-the-wall means, with respect to a gas furnace, one that is designed and marketed to be installed in an opening in an exterior wall that is fitted with a weatherized sleeve. (mural)

Subsection.Text: A gas furnace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 259, a gas furnace is not considered to be an energy-using product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it was manufactured before February 3, 1995;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a gas furnace for relocatable buildings that is manufactured before July 3, 2019; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is a replacement non-condensing gas furnace that is manufactured before July 3, 2019.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to gas furnaces described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A gas furnace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a gas furnace as defined in section 257.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B212 means the CSA standard CSA-B212-93 entitled Seasonal Energy Utilization Efficiencies of Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA B212)
oil-fired furnace means a warm-air furnace, other than a furnace for a mobile home or for a recreational vehicle, that has an input rate of not more than 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h) and that is either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exclusively oil-fired; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: capable of being fired, at the choice of the user, by either oil or another fuel. (générateur d’air chaud à mazout)

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired furnace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 263, an oil-fired furnace is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to oil-fired furnaces that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

An oil-fired furnace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to an oil-fired furnace as defined in section 261.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.4.1 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA P.4.1-02 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fireplace Efficiency. (CSA P.4.1)
CSA P.4.1-15 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA P.4.1-15 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fireplace Efficiency. (CSA P.4.1-15)

decorative gas fireplace means a vented fireplace that is fuelled by natural gas or propane, is marked for decorative use only and is not equipped with a thermostat or intended for use as a heater. (foyer à gaz décoratif)
gas fireplace means a decorative gas fireplace or a heating gas fireplace. (foyer à gaz)
heating gas fireplace means a vented fireplace that is fuelled by natural gas or propane and is not a decorative gas fireplace. (foyer à gaz de chauffage)

Subsection.Text: A gas fireplace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a gas fireplace is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 7, unless it is manufactured on or after June 1, 2003; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 266.1, unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to gas fireplaces described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A gas fireplace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a gas fireplace as defined in section 265.

Provision.Text: The product must be capable of

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: automatically extinguishing pilot flame when main gas burner flame is established;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: automatically extinguishing pilot flame when main gas burner flame is extinguished;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it has the capability of being manually switched to a mode of continuous pilot operation, preventing pilot flame from burning continuously for more than seven days; or

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: in absence of any automatic or manual adjustment to main gas burner flame height or appearance, preventing any ignition source for the main gas burner flame from operating continuously for more than seven days.
Must have a direct vent configuration, unless it is marked for replacement use only.
The product must be capable of

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: automatically extinguishing pilot flame when main gas burner flame is established;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: automatically extinguishing pilot flame when main gas burner flame is extinguished;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: if it has the capability of being manually switched to a mode of continuous pilot operation, preventing pilot flame from burning continuously for more than seven days; or

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: in absence of any automatic or manual adjustment to main gas burner flame height or appearance, preventing any ignition source for the main gas burner flame from operating continuously for more than seven days.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a gas fireplace:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of fuel it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum and minimum input rates, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the fireplace efficiency;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether it is freestanding, zero-clearance or an insert;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the type of ignition system it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the venting configuration the product has, namely, natural venting, direct venting or powered venting;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product is a decorative gas fireplace or a heating gas fireplace; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is a decorative gas fireplace that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020, information that indicates whether it is intended for use as a replacement unit.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA P.4.1, if the product was manufactured on or after June 1, 2003 and before January 1, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA P.4.1-15, if the product is manufactured on or after January 1, 2017.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.11 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.11-07 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Efficiency and Energy Consumption of Gas-fired Unit Heaters. (CSA P.11)

gas-fired unit heater means a self-contained, automatically controlled, vented, gas-burning appliance that distributes warmed air without the use of ducts and that has an input rate of not more than 2 931 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h). (aérotherme à gaz)

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired unit heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 270, a gas-fired unit-heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after August 8, 2008.
The following energy efficiency standards apply to a gas-fired unit heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its thermal efficiency must be at least 80% at the maximum heat input nominal capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be equipped with an intermittent ignition device and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a power-vented system,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an automatic vent damper, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an automatic flue damper.

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired unit heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA P.11 that are applicable to a gas-fired unit heater as defined in section 268.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA P.11 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas-fired unit heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of fuel it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of ignition system it has;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the venting configuration it has, namely, a power-vented system, an automatic vent damper or an automatic flue damper;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum heat input and output nominal capacities, expressed in kilowatts;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its thermal efficiency when at the maximum heat input nominal capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its electricity consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours, when at the maximum nominal heat input capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if it is a modulating or staged control gas-fired unit heater,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its reduced heat input and output nominal capacities, expressed in kilowatts, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its electricity consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours, when at reduced heat input nominal capacity.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, electric furnace means an automatic operating central forced air furnace that uses single-phase electric current to heat one or more electrical resistance heating elements and has an input rate of not more than 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h). It does not include an electric furnace that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produces at least 300 Pa (1.2 inches of water) external static pressure when operated at an air volume rate of 104 to 165 L/s (220 to 350 ft3/min) per nominal ton of cooling in the highest default cooling airflow-control setting; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: uses room outlets that produce velocities greater than 5 m/s (1,000 ft/min) and each have an area less than 39 cm2 (6 square inches).

Subsection.Text: An electric furnace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 274, an electric furnace is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after July 3, 2019.

The energy efficiency standard that applies to an electric furnace is that its FER must be less than or equal to the FER for product class “Non-Weatherized, Electric Furnace/Modular Blower Fan”, set out in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(y).

An electric furnace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix AA that are applicable to an electric furnace as defined in section 272.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with 10 C.F.R. Appendix AA and provided to the Minister in respect of an electric furnace:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum heat input nominal capacity, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its FER, expressed in watts per 472 L/s (watts per 1000 ft3/min); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum airflow (Qmax), expressed in L/s (ft3/min).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C439-18 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C439-18 entitled Laboratory methods of test for rating the performance of heat/energy-recovery ventilators. (CSA C439-18)

energy-recovery ventilator means a factory-built packaged unit that has fans or blowers, has a maximum rated airflow of not more than 142 L/s (300 ft3/min) at 0°C and transfers heat and moisture between two isolated airstreams. (ventilateur-récupérateur d’énergie)

heat-recovery ventilator means a factory-built packaged unit that has fans or blowers, has a maximum rated airflow of not more than 142 L/s (300 ft3/min) at 0°C and transfers heat between two isolated airstreams. (ventilateur-récupérateur de chaleur)

sensible heat recovery efficiency means, in respect of an energy-recovery ventilator or a heat-recovery ventilator, the ratio of the net sensible energy recovered by the unit’s supply airstream, as adjusted to account for the unit’s external and internal energy gains and losses, to the maximum sensible energy that would be recovered if the unit had an infinite transfer area. (efficacité de récupération de chaleur sensible)

Subsection.Text: An energy-recovery ventilator is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, an energy-recovery ventilator is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C439-18 and be provided to the Minister in respect of an energy-recovery ventilator:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum rated airflow at 0°C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its sensible heat recovery efficiency at 0°C and the associated net supply airflow, expressed in L/s, and electrical power consumption, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: unless the unit is marked for use only where the outdoor design temperature is greater than or equal to -10°C, its sensible heat recovery efficiency at -25°C and the associated net supply airflow, expressed in L/s.

Subsection.Text: A heat-recovery ventilator is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, a heat-recovery ventilator is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C439-18 and be provided to the Minister in respect of a heat-recovery ventilator:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum rated airflow at 0°C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its sensible heat recovery efficiency at 0°C and the associated net supply airflow, expressed in L/s, and electrical power consumption, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: unless the unit is marked for use only where the outdoor design temperature is greater than or equal to -10°C, its sensible heat recovery efficiency at -25°C and the associated net supply airflow, expressed in L/s.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: ASHRAE 103 means the ANSI/ASHRAE standard 103-2007 entitled Method of Testing for Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency of Residential Central Furnaces and Boilers. (ASHRAE 103)
automatic water temperature adjustment device means a device that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjusts the temperature of the water supplied by a boiler to ensure that an incremental change in inferred heat load produces a corresponding incremental change in the temperature of the water supplied or, if the boiler fires at a single input rate, automatically allows the burner or heating element to fire only when the device has determined that the inferred heat load cannot be met by the residual heat of the water in the system; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when there is no inferred heat load, limits the water temperature in the boiler to not more than 60°C. (dispositif automatique de réglage de la température de l’eau)

Definition.Text: CSA P.2 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.2-13 entitled Testing Method for Measuring the Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency of Residential Gas-Fired or Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA P.2)

10 C.F.R. Appendix A means Appendix A to Subpart E, Part 431 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for the Measurement of Thermal Efficiency and Combustion Efficiency of Commercial Packaged Boilers, as amended from time to time. (appendice A 10 C.F.R.)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CGA P.2 means the CGA standard CGA P.2-1991 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiencies of Residential Furnaces and Boilers. (CGA P.2)

gas boiler means a boiler that uses exclusively propane or natural gas, is intended for application in a low pressure steam, or hot water, central heating system and has an input rate of not more than 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h). (chaudière à gaz)

Section.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, a gas boiler is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: household, if it has an input rate of less than 87.92 kW (300,000 Btu/h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial, if it is has an input rate of greater than or equal to 87.92 kW (300,000 Btu/h) but not more than 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: A gas boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a gas boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 4 unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a household gas boiler that is manufactured on or after June 30, 1999, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a commercial gas boiler that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2025; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 317 unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a household gas boiler that is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a commercial gas boiler that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2025.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to household gas boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A household gas boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 of Table 1 that are applicable to a gas boiler as defined in section 315.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of Table 2 to this section apply to commercial gas boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2025.

A commercial gas boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix A that are applicable to a gas boiler as defined in section 315.

Commercial gas boilers that have an input rate of > 732.68 kW (2,500,000 Btu/h) but ≤ 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h) and are intended for low pressure steam systems

Provision.Text: type of automatic water temperature adjustment device it has, if any.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B212 means the CSA standard CSA-B212-93 entitled Seasonal Energy Utilization Efficiencies of Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA B212)
oil-fired boiler means a boiler that is intended for application in a low pressure steam, or hot water, central heating system, has an input rate of less than 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h) and is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exclusively oil-fired; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: capable of being fired, at the choice of the user, by either oil or another fuel. (chaudière à mazout)

Section.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, an oil-fired boiler is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: household, if it has an input rate of less than 87.92 kW (300,000 Btu/h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial, if it is has an input rate of greater than or equal to 87.92 kW (300,000 Btu/h) but not more than 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, an oil-fired boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 4, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a household oil-fired boiler that is manufactured on or after June 30, 1999, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a commercial oil-fired boiler that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2025; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 321, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a household oil-fired boiler that is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is a commercial oil-fired boiler that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2025.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to household oil-fired boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A household oil-fired boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 of Table 1 that are applicable to an oil-fired boiler as defined in section 319.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of Table 2 to this section apply to commercial oil-fired boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2025.

A commercial oil-fired boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix A that are applicable to an oil-fired boiler as defined in section 319.

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: thermal efficiency or, if product has an input rate of > 732.68 kW (2,500,000 Btu/h) but ≤ 2 930.71 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h) and is intended for hot water systems, combustion efficiency.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, electric boiler means a boiler that uses electric energy as a source of heat, is intended for application in a hot water central heating system, has an input rate of less than 88 kW (300,000 Btu/h) and is not equipped with tankless domestic water heating coils.

Subsection.Text: An electric boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 325, an electric boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after September 1, 2012.

Section.Text: The energy efficiency standard that applies to an electric boiler is that it must be equipped with an automatic water temperature adjustment device without which the boiler is not operable.
For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of an electric boiler:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its input rate, expressed in kilowatts, collected in accordance with ASHRAE 103; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of automatic water temperature adjustment device that it has.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA P.3-15 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.3-15 entitled Testing method for measuring energy consumption and determining efficiencies of gas-fired and fuel oil-fired water heaters. (CSA P.3-15)

first-hour rating means, in respect of a gas-fired storage water heater or an oil-fired water heater, the measure of the maximum volume of hot water that the water heater can supply within an hour that begins when the water in the water heater is fully heated. (capacité de première heure)

10 C.F.R. Appendix A means Appendix A to Subpart G, Part 431 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for the Measurement of Thermal Efficiency and Standby Loss of Gas-Fired and Oil-Fired Storage Water Heaters and Storage-Type Instantaneous Water Heaters, as amended from time to time. (appendice A 10 C.F.R.)
Vr means the nominal volume, expressed in litres, of a water heater’s storage tank. (Vr)
Vs means the measured storage volume, expressed in litres, of a water heater’s storage tank. (Vs)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: bottom inlet means a cold water inlet, other than one with a dip tube, that enters near the bottom of the water heater’s storage tank. (entrée inférieure)
CSA C191-04 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C191-04 entitled Performance of Electric Storage Tank Water Heaters for Domestic Hot Water Service. (CSA C191-04)

electric water heater means a stationary electric storage tank water heater that is intended for use on a pressurized water system and that has a Vr of at least 50 L (13.21 US gallons). (chauffe-eau électrique)

10 C.F.R. Appendix B means Appendix B to Subpart G, Part 431 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for the Measurement of Standby Loss of Electric Storage Water Heaters and Storage-Type Instantaneous Water Heaters, as amended from time to time. (appendice B 10 C.F.R.)

Section.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, an electric water heater is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: household, if it has an input rate of less than 12 kW (40,982 Btu/h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial, if it is has an input rate of greater than or equal to 12 kW (40,982 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: An electric water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, an electric water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 372 unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a household electric water heater that is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a commercial electric water heater that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to electric water heaters described in column 1.

An electric water heater described in column 1 complies with the energy efficiency standard set out in column 3 if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to an electric water heater as defined in section 370.

row.entry: Household electric water heaters that have a bottom inlet and a Vr of ≥ 50 L but ≤ 270 L
Household electric water heaters that have a bottom inlet and a Vr of > 270 L but ≤ 454 L
Household electric water heaters that have a top inlet and a Vr of ≥ 50 L but ≤ 270 L
Household electric water heaters that have a top inlet and a Vr of > 270 L but ≤ 454 L

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of an electric water heater described in column 1.

row.entry: Household electric water heaters manufactured on or after February 3 1995
CSA C191-04 for information set out in paragraphs (a) to (c)

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: nominal power input of upper and lower elements, in W;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: cold water inlet configuration, namely, top inlet or bottom inlet.

row.entry: Commercial electric water heaters manufactured on or after January 1, 2020

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.3-04 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.3-04 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Energy Consumption and Determining Efficiencies of Gas-Fired Storage Water Heaters. (CSA P.3-04)

gas-fired storage water heater means a stationary gas-heated water container that uses propane or natural gas for fuel and has a Vr of at least 76 L (20 US gallons). (chauffe-eau à réservoir alimenté au gaz)
replacement unit means a commercial gas-fired storage water heater that is marked for replacement installations only. (unité de remplacement)

Section.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, a gas-fired storage water heater is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: household, if it has an input rate of less than or equal to 21.97 kW (75,000 Btu/h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial, if it is has an input rate of greater than 21.97 kW (75,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired storage water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 376, a gas-fired storage water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a household gas-fired storage water heater that is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a commercial gas-fired storage water heater that is manufactured on or after July 1, 2023.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to household gas-fired storage water heaters described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A household gas-fired storage water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a gas-fired storage water heater as defined in section 374.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of Table 2 to this section apply to commercial gas-fired storage water heaters described in column 1 that are manufactured on or after July 1, 2023.

A commercial gas-fired storage water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix A that are applicable to a gas-fired storage water heater as defined in section 374.

On or after December 31, 2016 and before January 1, 2018
Household gas-fired storage water heaters that have a first-hour rating of < 68 L (18 US gallons)

Must have at least one of the following:

Must have at least one of the following:

Commercial gas-fired storage water heaters that are replacement units, that have an input rate of > 21.97 kW (75,000 Btu/h) but≤ 30.5 kW (105,000 Btu/h), have a Vr of ≤ 454 L (120 US gallons), use single-phase power and limit water temperatures to < 82°C (180°F)
Commercial gas-fired storage water heaters, other than those described in items 1 and 2, that are not replacement units

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas-fired storage water heater described in column 1.

Household gas-fired storage water heaters that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2018

CSA P.3-15, if a certification body has verified that product is in compliance with energy efficiency standard set out in any of paragraphs 3(b), 4(b), 5(b) and 6(b) of Table 1 to section 376.

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: energy factor, if a certification body has verified that product is in compliance with the energy efficiency standard set out in any of paragraphs 3(a), 4(a), 5(a) and 6(a) of Table 1 to section 376; and

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: uniform energy factor and Vs, if a certification body has verified that product is in compliance with the energy efficiency standard set out in any of paragraphs 3(b), 4(b), 5(b) and 6(b) of Table 1 to section 376.

Provision.Label: (e)

Provision.Label: (f)

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: information that indicates whether product is a replacement unit.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B211-00 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-B211-00 entitled Energy Efficiency of Oil-Fired Storage Tank Water Heaters. (CSA B211-00)
oil-fired water heater means a water heater that uses oil for fuel and that has a Vr of at least 76 L (20 US gallons). (chauffe-eau à mazout)

Section.Text: For the purpose of these Regulations, an oil-fired water heater is one of the following types:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: household, if it has an input rate of less than or equal to 30.5 kW (105,000 Btu/h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial, if it is has an input rate of greater than 30.5 kW (105,000 Btu/h).

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 380, an oil-fired water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a household oil-fired water heater that is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a commercial oil-fired water heater that is manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of Table 1 to this section apply to household oil-fired water heaters described in column 1 that are manufactured during the period set out in column 4.

An oil-fired water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a oil-fired water heater as defined in section 378.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of Table 2 to this section apply to commercial oil-fired water heaters described in column 1 that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2020.

A commercial oil-fired water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by 10 C.F.R. Appendix A that are applicable to a oil-fired water heater as defined in section 378.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before December 31, 2016
On or after December 31, 2016 and before January 1, 2018
Household oil-fired water heaters that have a first-hour rating of < 68 L (18 US gallons)

Must have at least one of the following:

Commercial oil-fired storage water heaters, other than those described in item 1, that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2020

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of an oil-fired storage water heater described in column 1.

Household oil-fired water heaters that are manufactured on or after January 1, 2018
