Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: whether it is high-frequency or low-frequency.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C863-16 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA C863-16 entitled Energy efficiency of high-intensity discharge (HID) and low-pressure sodium (LPS) lamp ballasts. (CSA C863-16)

electronic ballast means a ballast that is controlled by a transistor, thyristor or other active electronic component and in which impedance is provided by capacitive or inductive reactance. (ballast électronique)
magnetic-regulated lamp ballast means a ballast that operates at a lagging high power factor and that has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three coils;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: isolated secondary windings; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a constant-voltage regulator that, in conjunction with capacitive reactance, provides power factor correction and lamp wattage regulation. (ballast à régulation magnétique)

Definition.Text: metal halide lamp ballast means a device that is used to obtain the voltage, current and waveform necessary for starting and operating a metal halide lamp that has a nominal power of at least 50 W but not more than 1 000 W. It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a magnetic-regulated lamp ballast;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a replacement metal halide lamp ballast; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an electronic ballast that is designed for a nominal voltage of 480 V or to operate a lamp at an output frequency of 1000 Hz or more. (ballast pour lampes aux halogénures métalliques)

Definition.Text: replacement metal halide lamp ballast means a ballast that is marketed for use as replacement ballast for a metal halide luminaire installation and that is sold in a package of 10 or fewer. (ballast pour lampes aux halogénures métalliques de remplacement)

Subsection.Text: A metal halide lamp ballast is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 455, a metal halide lamp ballast is not considered to be an energy-using product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it was manufactured before February 10, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is manufactured before December 31, 2019 and is capable of using a nominal voltage of 347 V.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in Table 3 of CSA C863-16 apply to metal halide lamp ballasts.

A metal halide lamp ballast complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C863-16 that are applicable to a metal halide lamp ballast as defined in section 453.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C863-16 and provided to the Minister in respect of a metal halide lamp ballast:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the efficiency of the lamp and ballast combination, expressed as a percentage;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal voltage;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its input power, in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the power, in watts, of the lamps that the ballast is designed to operate; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its power factor.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 means the CSA standard C22.2 No. 250.0-08 entitled Luminaires. (CSA C22.2 No. 250.0)

pin-based means, with respect to a socket of a ceiling fan or ceiling fan light kit, one that is designed to hold a fluorescent lamp that is not integrally ballasted and that has a plug-in lamp base. It does not include a GU-24 socket. (à broche)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 means the CSA standard C22.2 No. 250.4-14 entitled Portable luminaires. (CSA C22.2 No. 250.4)

torchiere means a portable luminaire that has a reflector bowl or similar-shaped reflector that directs light in a predominantly upward direction for the purpose of providing indirect lighting and that may be equipped with one or more additional sockets intended for other lighting functions. (torchère)

Subsection.Text: A torchiere is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 509, a torchiere is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to torchieres described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A torchiere complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 that are applicable to a torchiere as defined in section 507.

row.entry: Torchieres that have no additional sockets
On or after January 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2010
Torchieres that have no additional sockets
Torchieres that have one or more additional sockets
On or after January 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2010
Torchieres that have one or more additional sockets

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 and provided to the Minister in respect of a torchiere:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product has lighting functions additional to those of the bowl; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total power, expressed in watts, for all lighting functions.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: ceiling fan light kit means equipment that is designed to provide light from a ceiling fan and that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: integral to the fan before its retail sale; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: attachable to the fan after its retail sale. (ensemble d’éclairage pour ventilateurs de plafond)

Definition.Text: integrated solid-state lighting circuitry means the circuitry in a ceiling fan light kit that is not replaceable by a consumer and that is used to connect the light kit’s solid-state lighting components. (circuits intégrés d’éclairage à semi-conducteurs)
10 C.F.R. §430.23(x)(2) means paragraph 430.23(x)(2) of Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.23(x)(2))

10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(6) means the table to paragraph 430.32(s)(6) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(6))

Subsection.Text: A ceiling fan light kit is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a ceiling fan light kit is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, if it was manufactured before January 1, 2010; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 517,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it was manufactured before January 1, 2010,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010 and before January 7, 2019, it has a total power less than or equal to 10 W or only pin-based sockets, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after January 7, 2019, it has at least one socket, has maximum wattage markings on each socket that together indicate that the combined total power for the lighting is less than or equal to 70 W and does not have integrated solid state lighting circuitry.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to ceiling fan light kits described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A ceiling fan light kit complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a ceiling fan light kit as defined in section 515.

row.entry: On or after January 1, 2010 and before January 7, 2019
Ceiling fan light kits that have at least one socket, that are not packaged with a lamp for each socket and that do not have integrated solid-state lighting circuitry
Ceiling fan light kits that have at least one socket, that are packaged with a lamp for each socket, but that do not have integrated solid-state lighting circuitry
Lighting efficacy ≥ minimum required efficacy in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(6)
Ceiling fans light kits that have integrated solid-state lighting circuitry
Lighting efficacy ≥ minimum required efficacy in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(s)(6)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a ceiling fan light kit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it has at least one socket, the type of socket and the number of each type of socket;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it has integrated solid-state lighting circuitry, the lighting efficacy, expressed in lumens per watt;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it has a pin-based socket, the ballast type;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it is packaged with lamps, their type, brand name and model number; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the total power for the lighting, expressed in watts.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 or 10 C.F.R. §430.23(x)(2).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C860 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA C860-11 entitled Performance of Internally Lighted Exit Signs. (CSA C860)
exit sign has the same meaning as in CSA C860. It does not include an exit sign that flashes or that is photoluminescent or radioluminescent. (enseigne de sortie)
legend means any of the following that is displayed on an exit sign:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a representation of a running person, as described in Annex B.1 of the CSA standard CSA C22.2 No. 141 entitled Emergency lighting equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the word “EXIT” or “SORTIE”. (légende)

Subsection.Text: An exit sign is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purpose of section 4, an exit sign is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after November 1, 2004.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to exit signs described in column 1.

An exit sign complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C860 that are applicable to an exit sign as defined in section 519.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C860 and provided to the Minister in respect of an exit sign:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its power consumption, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of legends.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: traffic signal module means a self-contained device that is designed to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fit into a traffic signal housing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide drivers with movement information by means of a red or green traffic signal indicator that has a nominal diameter of 200 mm (8 inches) or 300 mm (12 inches). (module de signalisation routière)

Definition.Text: VTCSH Arrow means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Vehicle Traffic Control Signal Heads: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Vehicle Arrow Traffic Signal Supplement, dated July 1, 2007. (VTCSH Arrow)

VTCSH Circular means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Vehicle Traffic Control Signal Heads: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Circular Signal Supplement, dated June 27, 2005. (VTCSH Circular)

Subsection.Text: A traffic signal module is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 525, a traffic signal module is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to traffic signal modules described in column 1.
For the purpose of subsection (1), the maximum power and nominal power of a traffic signal module must be determined in accordance with the following procedures:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the luminous intensity of the product must be determined in accordance with the procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a traffic signal module as defined in section 523;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s power must be measured using a watt meter that has an accuracy of ± 1%;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s maximum power, the product must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: mounted in a temperature testing chamber with the lens portion of the product outside the chamber, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at a temperature of 74°C and with the temperature in front of the lens maintained at a minimum of 49°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s nominal power, the product must be operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at an ambient temperature of 25°C.

row.entry: Traffic signal modules that have a red traffic signal indicator that has a nominal diameter of 200 mm (8 inches)
Traffic signal modules that have a red traffic signal indicator that has a nominal diameter of 300 mm (12 inches)
Traffic signal modules that have a green traffic signal indicator that has a nominal diameter of 200 mm (8 inches)
Traffic signal modules that have a green traffic signal indicator that has a nominal diameter of 300 mm (12 inches)
Traffic signal modules that have a red arrow traffic signal indicator
Traffic signal modules that have a green arrow traffic signal indicator

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a traffic signal module:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum power, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: VTCSH Arrow, if the traffic signal module has an arrow traffic signal indicator; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: VTCSH Circular, if the traffic signal module has any other traffic signal indicator.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: pedestrian module means a self-contained device that is designed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to fit into a pedestrian signal housing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to provide pedestrians with movement information by means of a walking person display or a hand display but not by means of a countdown message. (module de signalisation piétonnière)

Definition.Text: PTCSI means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Pedestrian Traffic Control Signal Indicators: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Signal Modules, dated August 4, 2010. (PTCSI)

Subsection.Text: A pedestrian module is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 529, a pedestrian module is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to pedestrian modules described in column 1.
For the purpose of subsection (1), the maximum power and nominal power of a pedestrian module must be determined in accordance with the following procedures:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the luminous intensity of the product must be determined in accordance with the procedures established by PTCSI that are applicable to a pedestrian module as defined in section 527;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s power must be measured using a watt meter that has an accuracy of ± 1%;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s maximum power, the product must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: mounted in a temperature testing chamber with the lens portion of the product outside the chamber, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at a temperature of 74°C and with the temperature in front of the lens maintained at a minimum temperature of 49°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s nominal power, the product must be operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at an ambient temperature of 25°C.

row.entry: Pedestrian modules that have a walking person display and a hand display
Pedestrian modules that have a walking person display only
Pedestrian modules that have a hand display only

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with PTCSI and provided to the Minister in respect of a pedestrian module:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum power, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C62301 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C62301:11 entitled Household electrical appliances – Measurement of standby power. (CSA C62301)
information display means a clock or other device that provides visual alphanumeric or graphical information or indicates the status of the equipment. (affichage)
medical device has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Medical Devices Regulations. (instrument médical)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: compact audio product means a product that consists of an amplifier and a terrestrial tuner that are encased in a single housing — including a product that can produce sound from another media — and that uses mains power as at least one source of power and has attached or separable speakers. (produit audio compact)

off mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power, cannot produce sound or provide any mechanical function and cannot be switched into another mode except by means of a manual switch on the product. (mode arrêt)
standby mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not producing sound, providing mechanical function or exchanging data with, or receiving it from, an external source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: can be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, an internal signal or an internal timer. (mode veille)

Subsection.Text: A compact audio product is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 576, a compact audio product is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after May 1, 2011.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to compact audio products described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A compact audio product complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C62301 that are applicable to a compact audio product as defined in section 574.

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

row.entry: On or after May 1, 2011 and before January 1, 2013
Compact audio products, other than clock radios

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: ≤ 1 W in standby mode with information display active;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode with information display inactive;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode when there is no information display; and

row.entry: Compact audio products that are clock radios

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: ≤ 2 W in standby mode with information display active; and

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C62301 and provided to the Minister in respect of a compact audio product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it was manufactured before January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts, as applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display active,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display inactive, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: without the information display;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it has standby mode, the period, expressed in minutes, that begins when standby mode is enabled and ends when the measurement of power consumption in that mode is completed; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if it has off mode, its power consumption, expressed in watts, in off mode.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power, cannot provide any mechanical function and cannot be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, a timer or another internal or external signal. (mode arrêt)
standby mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not producing video or audio output signals, providing any mechanical function or exchanging data with, or receiving it from, an external source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: can be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, an internal signal or an internal timer. (mode veille)

Definition.Text: video product means a household electronic product that is encased in a single housing, requires a power supply device in order to operate and is designed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to be connected to mains power; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: primarily to do one or both of the following, namely, produce audio and video signals from, or record those signals to, digital or analog media.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It does not include a camera or a portable DVD player that has both an integral display screen and a DC power source. (appareil vidéo)

Subsection.Text: A video product is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 580, a video product is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after May 1, 2011.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 1 of the table to this section apply to video products that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 2.

A video product complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C62301 that are applicable to a video product as defined in section 578.

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

row.entry: On or after May 1, 2011 and before January 1, 2013

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: ≤ 1 W in standby mode with information display active;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode with information display inactive;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode without information display; and

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C62301 and provided to the Minister in respect of a video product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it was manufactured before January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts, as applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display active,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display inactive, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: without the information display;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it has standby mode, the period, expressed in minutes, that begins when standby mode is enabled and ends when the measurement of power consumption in that mode is completed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it has off mode, its power consumption, expressed in watts, in off mode; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the type of playback or recording technology that it has.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: off mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power, cannot produce either sound or picture or provide any mechanical function and cannot be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, a timer or another internal or external signal. (mode arrêt)
standby mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not producing sound or picture, providing any mechanical function or exchanging data with, or receiving it from, an external source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: can be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, an internal signal or an internal timer. (mode veille)

Definition.Text: television means an analog or digital product, with or without an internal tuner, that is designed primarily for the display and reception of a terrestrial, satellite, cable, Internet Protocol TV or other broadcast or recorded transmission of analog or digital video and audio signals and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a combination television system in which a television and one or more other devices are encased as a single unit in the television casing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a component television that has two or more separate components and that is marketed and sold as a television under one model or system designation.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a television that is marketed exclusively for commercial use and is without an internal tuner; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a television that is marketed primarily for use as a computer monitor. (téléviseur)

Subsection.Text: A television is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 584, a television is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after May 1, 2011.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 1 of the table to this section apply to televisions that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 2.

A television complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C62301 that are applicable to a television as defined in section 582.

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

row.entry: On or after May 1, 2011 and before January 1, 2013

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: ≤ 1 W in standby mode with information display active;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode with information display inactive;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: ≤ 0.5 W in standby mode without information display; and

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C62301 and provided to the Minister in respect of a television:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it was manufactured before January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2013 and has standby mode, its power consumption in that mode, expressed in watts, as applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display active,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the information display inactive, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: without the information display;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it has standby mode, the period, expressed in minutes, that begins when standby mode is enabled and ends when the measurement of power consumption in standby mode is completed; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it has off mode, its power consumption, expressed in watts, in off mode.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: adaptive external power supply means an external power supply that, without user intervention and while it is connected to mains power and each output is connected to a load, can alter the output voltage using a digital communication protocol with the end-use product. (bloc d’alimentation externe adaptatif)
CSA C381.1 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C381.1-08 entitled Test method for calculating the energy efficiency of single-voltage external ac-ac and ac-ac power supplies. (CSA C381.1)
CSA C381.1-17 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA C381.1-17 entitled Energy performance of external ac-dc and ac-ac power supplies. (CSA C381.1-17)

detachable battery pack means a battery that is encased in an enclosure separate from an end-use product and that is designed to be removed or disconnected from the end-use product for recharging. (bloc-batterie amovible)

direct operation external power supply means a power supply device that is capable of operating an end-use product, other than a battery charger, without the assistance of a battery. (bloc d’alimentation externe à fonctionnement direct)

external power supply means a single-voltage external power supply or a multiple-voltage external power supply that is designed to be used with a household or office end-use product that constitutes the primary load. It does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a direct operation external power supply that has a nominal output voltage of less than 3 V and a nominal output current of 1 000 mA or more and that charges the battery of an end-use product that is fully or primarily motor-operated;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indirect operation external power supply that has a nominal output power of greater than 250 W;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a device that powers the charger of a detachable battery pack of an end-use product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a device that is an accessory to a medical device; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a device that is solely designed to power solid-state lighting or a ceiling fan that has a direct current motor. (bloc d’alimentation externe)

Definition.Text: indirect operation external power supply means a power supply device that can only operate an end-use product with the assistance of a battery. (bloc d’alimentation externe à fonctionnement indirect)

multiple-voltage external power supply means a device that is designed to convert line voltage AC input into more than one simultaneous lower voltage AC or DC outputs. (bloc d’alimentation externe à tensions multiples)

replacement external power supply means an external power supply that is marked as a replacement to be used with a specific end-use product that was manufactured before July 1, 2017. (bloc d’alimentation externe de remplacement)
security external power supply means an external power supply manufactured before July 1, 2017 that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is designed to convert line voltage AC into lower voltage AC output;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a nominal output power of 20 W or more; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is designed for and marketed with equipment that operates continuously in on mode to perform any of the following principal functions:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to monitor, detect, record or provide notification of any intrusion on real property or immovables, or access to real property or immovables or physical assets,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to provide notification of threats to personal safety resulting from an intrusion or access referred to in subparagraph (i),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to monitor, detect, record or provide notification of fire, gas, smoke, flooding or any other physical threats to real property or immovables, physical assets or personal safety, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: to deter or control access to real property or immovables or physical assets or prevent the unauthorized removal of physical assets.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It includes an external power supply for equipment that is designed and marketed with a built-in alarm or theft-deterrent feature and whose principal functions are those referred to in paragraph (c). (bloc d’alimentation externe de sécurité)

Definition.Text: single-voltage external power supply means a device that is designed to convert line voltage AC input into only one lower AC or DC voltage output at a time. (bloc d’alimentation externe à simple tension)

10 C.F.R. Appendix Z means Appendix Z to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of External Power Supplies, as amended from time to time. (appendice Z 10 C.F.R.)

10 C.F.R. §430.32(w)(1)(i) means the table to paragraph 430.32(w)(1)(i) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(w)(1)(i))
verification mark has the same meaning as in section 2. (marque de vérification)

Subsection.Text: An external power supply is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, an external power supply is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5 if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it was manufactured before July 1, 2010, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it was manufactured on or after July 1, 2010 and before July 1, 2017 and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is a multiple-voltage external power supply or an adaptive external power supply,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: it is a direct operation external power supply that has a nominal output power of greater than 250 W, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: it is an indirect operation external power supply that has a nominal output voltage of greater than 3 V and a nominal output current of less than 1 000 mA and that charges the battery of an end-use product that is fully or primarily motor-operated; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 588 if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it was manufactured before July 1, 2010,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it was manufactured on or after July 1, 2010 and before July 1, 2017 and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is a multiple-voltage external power supply or an adaptive external power supply,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: it is a direct operation external power supply that has a nominal output power of greater than 250 W, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: it is an indirect operation external power supply that has a nominal output voltage of greater than 3 V and a nominal output current of less than 1 000 mA and that charges the battery of an end-use product that is fully or primarily motor-operated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it was manufactured before July 1, 2013 and is a replacement external power supply.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to external power supplies described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

An external power supply complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to an external power supply as defined in subsection 586(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must provided to the Minister in respect of an external power supply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product is a single-voltage external power supply or a multiple-voltage external power supply;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each voltage output, its nominal output voltage at the highest and lowest settings and information that indicates whether that voltage is AC or DC;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal output power, expressed in watts, at the highest and lowest power settings, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its average efficiency at the highest and lowest power settings, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its power in no-load mode, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Roman numeral mark, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product bears a verification mark; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product is a replacement external power supply or a security external power supply and, if it is one of those power supplies, the end-use product or equipment, as applicable, and the model number and brand of that end-use product or equipment.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with a standard set out in column 2 of the table to this section in respect of an external power supply described in column 1.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: backup battery charger means a device that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is incorporated into an end-use product, including a device that is incorporated into an uninterruptible power supply or that uses an external power supply, that is designed to operate continuously using mains power; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recharges a battery that is used to maintain the continuity of electrical power to the end-use product such that the product can continue its full or partial operation in the event of a failure of mains power. (chargeur de batterie de secours)

Definition.Text: battery charger means a device that charges the battery of a wheelchair, golf cart, low-speed vehicle or any other end-use product. It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a device that charges the battery of a vehicle other than a wheelchair, golf cart or low-speed vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a device that charges the battery of a medical device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a wireless battery charger, other than a wireless battery charger that is inductive and designed for wet environments; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a backup battery charger. (chargeur de batterie)

Definition.Text: CSA C381.2-17 means the CSA standard CSA C381.2-17 entitled Energy performance of battery-charging systems and uninterruptible power supplies. (CSA C381.2-17)
low-speed vehicle means a vehicle that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not use fuel as an on-board source of energy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: travels on two or more wheels;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is powered by an electric power train that is designed to allow the vehicle to attain a speed of no greater than 40 km/h over a distance of 1.6 km on a paved level surface; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has a loaded weight, as specified by its manufacturer, of less than 1 361 kg. (véhicule à basse vitesse)

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix Y means Appendix Y to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring the Energy Consumption of Battery Chargers, as amended from time to time. (appendice Y 10 C.F.R.)

Subsection.Text: A battery charger is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 592, a battery charger is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after June 13, 2019.
A battery charger must have a unit energy consumption that is less than or equal to that set out for the battery charger’s product class in Table C.1 of CSA C381.2-17.

A battery charger complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with the testing procedures established by CSA C381.2-17 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix Y that are applicable to a battery charger as defined in section 590.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C381.2-17 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix Y and provided to the Minister in respect of a battery charger:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its product class;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its rated battery energy (Ebatt), expressed in watt-hours;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its unit energy consumption, expressed in kilowatt-hours per year;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its power, expressed in watts, when it is in active mode, maintenance mode and standby mode, respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if an external power supply was used to test the battery charger, the power supply’s model number and the name of its manufacturer.

Section.Text: In this Division, Edaily means the daily energy consumption of a product, expressed in kilowatt hours per day.
The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: AV means, in respect of a commercial refrigerator-freezer, its adjusted volume in litres, which is the sum of the refrigerator volume and 1.63 times the freezer volume. (VC)
closed means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a refrigerated compartment of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer, that all its points of access can be closed off from the outside by a physical barrier and from which any refrigerated item can be accessed by opening a door or drawer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer, that all of its compartments are as described in paragraph (a). (type fermé)

Definition.Text: commercial freezer means a freezer that is self-contained or remote-condensing, that uses or is designed to be used with a vapour-compression refrigeration system and whose compartments are all designed for the freezing and display or storage of food, beverages or ice at temperatures below 0°C. It does not include a household freezer or walk-in freezer. (congélateur commercial)

commercial refrigerator means a refrigerator that is self-contained or remote-condensing, that uses or is designed to be used with a vapour-compression refrigeration system and whose compartments are all designed for the display or storage of food, beverages or flowers at temperatures at or above 0°C. It does not include a household refrigerator, refrigerated buffet table, refrigerated preparation table or walk-in cooler. (réfrigérateur commercial)

commercial refrigerator-freezer means a refrigerator-freezer that is self-contained or remote-condensing, that uses or is designed to be used with a vapour-compression refrigeration system and that has two or more compartments, at least one of which is designed for the display or storage of food and beverages at temperatures at or above 0°C and at least one of which is designed for the freezing and display or storage of food and beverages at temperatures below 0°C. It does not include a household refrigerator-freezer, walk-in freezer or walk-in cooler. (réfrigérateur-congélateur commercial)
CSA C657 means the CSA standard CSA C657-2015 entitled Energy Performance Standard for Commercial Refrigeration Equipment. (CSA C657)

ice cream freezer means a commercial freezer that is designed to operate at temperatures at or below –21°C ± 1.1°C and that is designed or marketed for the storage, display or dispensing of ice cream. (congélateur de crème glacée)
open means, in respect of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer — or a refrigerated compartment of one — that it is not closed. (type ouvert)

pull-down temperature reduction capability means the capability of a commercial refrigerator, when it is situated in an area that has an ambient temperature of 32.22˚C and when it is fully loaded with 355 mL beverage cans that are at a temperature of 32.22˚C at the time of loading, to cool those cans to an average stable temperature of 3.33˚C in 12 hours or less. (capacité d’abaisser la température)
TDA means the total display area of a product, expressed in square metres. (TDA)
transparent means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a refrigerated compartment of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer, that it is closed and has a TDA that is at least 75% of the geometrically projected area of the refrigerated space on the plane of the face with the largest access space; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer, that all of its compartments are as described in paragraph (a). (transparent)

Definition.Text: V means, in respect of a refrigerated compartment of a commercial refrigerator, commercial refrigerator-freezer or commercial freezer, its volume, expressed in litres, calculated in accordance with clause 8 of CSA C657. (V)

Subsection.Text: A commercial refrigerator is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a commercial refrigerator is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained and manufactured on or after April 1, 2007, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is remote-condensing and manufactured on or after January 1, 2012; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 638, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, closed and was manufactured on or after April 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2012, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to commercial refrigerators described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A commercial refrigerator complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a commercial refrigerator as defined in section 636.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a commercial refrigerator:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its Edaily;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each of its compartments,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its equipment class designation and its TDA or V, as applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is tested at its lowest temperature setting, the integrated average temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius, at the lowest temperature setting.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C657, Test Procedure A, if the product was manufactured before March 27, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C657, Test Procedure B, if the product is manufactured on or after March 27, 2017.

Subsection.Text: A commercial refrigerator-freezer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a commercial refrigerator-freezer is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, is closed and is manufactured on or after April 1, 2007,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, is open and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is remote-condensing and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 641, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, is closed, is not transparent and is manufactured on or after April 1, 2007,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, is open or transparent and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is remote-condensing and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to commercial refrigerator-freezers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A commercial refrigerator-freezer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a commercial refrigerator-freezer as defined in section 636.

Provision.Label: (c)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: for each compartment, its equipment class designation and its TDA or V, as applicable.

Subsection.Text: A commercial freezer is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a commercial freezer is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained and manufactured on or after April 1, 2007, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is remote-condensing and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 644, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is self-contained, closed and was manufactured on or after April 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2012, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2012.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to commercial freezers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A commercial freezer complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a commercial freezer as defined in section 636.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a commercial freezer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its Edaily; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C657, Test Procedure A, if the product was manufactured before March 27, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
